intro: Souroubea intermedia, commonly known as the African souroubea, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
